info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 2:18PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Rabun and central Oconee Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 218 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Clayton, or 6 miles northeast of Tallulah Gorge State Park, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Walhalla, Sky Valley, Oconee State Park, Lake Jocassee, Devils Fork State Park, Tallulah Gorge State Park, Westminster, Mountain Rest, Long Creek and Pine Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
